page.title: 05LATTON PRIORY FARM
page.content: Near Junction 7 of the M11,off the B1393 Harlow-Thornwood road,we find Latton Priory Farm. In the farm we saw the remains of an old Priory.This building is now used to store farm machinery. The farm owner keeps over a hundred bullocks in large sheds with a paddock next to them.The farm is arable,with oilseed rape,peas,beans and barley growing in the fields.Two small fields of linseed were grown,hoping for good weather to give a good yield. The Priory was originally the work of the Augustinian monks.The Priory still has its original architecture,with tiles on the original wood beams.The walls are of flint stones and the floor is still cobbled.
